channel.title: Please Explain How Injection/Reflection Bots work
channel.description:
Be as detailed but also as concise as you can, state it in a way anyone (noobs) could understand.
I'm assuming all java bots use one of these two methods (PowreBot, EpicBot, TriBot, OSBot, etc.)
If any of them use some other method or some other special techniques that you know of please include that too.
Thanks!

item.title: Please Explain How Injection/Reflection Bots work
item.dc:creator: @Ollie Ollie
item.description:
@Ollie wrote:

Your best option is to delve into it and come with questions rather than asking us to explain everything we know. you will receive greater feedback and you will learn whilst you code.

Read full topic
item.source: Please Explain How Injection/Reflection Bots work

item.title: Please Explain How Injection/Reflection Bots work
item.dc:creator: @Pwnd Pwnd
item.description:
@Pwnd wrote:

Injection bots, basically, create accessor methods for variables/methods that’d normally be private or inaccessible outside of the class in which those components are contained. There’s more to it in regards to avoiding detection, etc. but that’s the jist. I can’t be any more detailed for the same reason Rodger cannot.

Read full topic
item.source: Please Explain How Injection/Reflection Bots work

item.title: Please Explain How Injection/Reflection Bots work
item.dc:creator: @Rodgerwilco Rodgerwilco
item.description:
@Rodgerwilco wrote:

Injection bots inject into the RuneScape applet, reading the game’s code directly to determine what is what. Reflection bots create a mirror image of the RuneScape applet by accessing the loaded classes and then read the code of the “reflected” copy, without injecting any code.

There are plenty of examples around these parts which will introduce yourself to bcel. I have barely touched bcel or reflection so I have no business explaining but I do know the concept or each.

Read full topic
item.source: Please Explain How Injection/Reflection Bots work
